concepts.title: Diodes
concepts.description: Semiconductor devices that allow current flow in one direction only
concepts.detailedDescription: A diode is a two-terminal electronic component that conducts current primarily in one direction (asymmetric conductance). It has low resistance in one direction and high resistance in the opposite direction. Diodes are fundamental building blocks in electronic circuits and are used for rectification, voltage regulation, and signal processing.
examples: Power supply rectification using bridge rectifiers
Signal demodulation in AM radio receivers
Freewheeling diodes in motor control circuits
formulas: V_z = constant for Zener diodes in reverse breakdown
keyPoints: Forward bias: Anode positive relative to cathode
Reverse bias: Cathode positive relative to anode
Threshold voltage (V_f) must be exceeded for conduction
Reverse breakdown occurs at Zener voltage

concepts.title: Transistors
concepts.description: Three-terminal devices used for amplification and switching applications
concepts.detailedDescription: Transistors are semiconductor devices with three terminals used to amplify or switch electronic signals and electrical power. They are composed of semiconductor material with at least three terminals for connection to an external circuit. The two main types are Bipolar Junction Transistors (BJT) and Field-Effect Transistors (FET).
examples: Power control in motor drive circuits
keyPoints: BJT: Current controlled device (Base current controls Collector current)
FET: Voltage controlled device (Gate voltage controls Drain current)
Three configurations: Common Emitter, Common Base, Common Collector
Active, Cutoff, and Saturation regions of operation

concepts.title: Operational Amplifiers
concepts.description: High-gain differential amplifiers used in analog circuit applications
concepts.detailedDescription: An operational amplifier (op-amp) is a DC-coupled high-gain electronic voltage amplifier with a differential input and usually a single-ended output. Op-amps are among the most widely used electronic devices today, being used in a vast array of consumer, industrial, and scientific devices.
keyPoints: Virtual short circuit between inputs in feedback
